page.title: 02St Peters Church Diddlebury
page.content:
Diddlebury Church is the only C.E. church on our map.It dates back to Saxon times.The north wall has very conspicuous herring bone patterns in stone work.It is one of the finest examples of 11th century building.The chancel is mostly Norman.
The vicar of the church is the Rev I.Gibbs who is vicar of 5 churches.At Diddlebury church there are 2 wardens and Fred Jordan is the sexton.There are about 3 weddings a year and in May and June there were 2 christenings and 1 funeral.
The service times are 9.00am 10.00am 6.30pm but not on the same sunday.The last comfirmation was 5 years ago but no one is interested enough to want to be comfirmed at present.
